section.p: This section describes the parameters required to create a user. Log into the SM GUI, navigate to Subscriber Manager> Devices tab.
To add a device, click , add the basic details, associations, and custom data to the device as described in the given table:

entry.p: Parameter
Description
Options
Mandatory/Optional

row.entry: This parameter indicates a unique name of the device.

entry.p: This parameter indicates the subscription ID type carried by the subscription ID Accelerated Value Program (AVP). Each device is associated with a list of identities that consist of an identifier and an identifier type as a pair.
For device lookup to succeed, the device must match atleast one subscription-Id-type and data from Call Control Request (CCR). The parameter can be either of the following:

li.p: E164 international format (for example, MSISDN), according to the ITU-T E.164 numbering plan defined in [E164] and [CE164].

entry.p: Select the required identifier type from the predefined identifier types in the drop-down list.
Note: The Identifier Type data values for International Mobile Subscriber Identity (IMSI) and E.164 subscription IDs must be numeric strings up to 15 characters.

li.p: IMSI format according to the ITU-T E.212 numbering plan as defined in [E212] and [CE212].
NAI defined as Network Access Identifier identifies the users that request access to a network. The standard syntax is "user@realm".

SIP URI, as defined in [SIP]. The Session Initiation Protocol Uniform Resource Identifier (SIP URI) resembles an e-mail address and is written in the following format: x@y:port (x=Username, y=host|domain|IP)
PRIVATE is a credit-control server private identifier.
EXTERNALID is defined in 3GPP TS 23.003 and is composed of Domain Identifier and Local Identifier. The standard syntax is: Local-Identifier@Domain-Identifier.

entry.p: This parameter indicates the value carried by the subscription ID AVP. Each device is associated with a list of identifiers that consist of an identifier and an identifier type as a pair.
Click Add Identifier button to add more identifiers to the same device.

The Mobile Subscription Identification Number (MSIN) must be less than 10 digits. IMSI values contain Mobile Country Code (MCC) which are the first three digits and MSIN which are the last three digits. The overall length of the IMSI value is up to 15 characters.
If the user has an Internet of Things (IoT) appliance, such as water meter which is not a unique factor, then Universal Unique Identifier (UUID) is used.
If a single SIM is used in more than one device or a number of different SIMs are used in a single device on multiple occasions, then a list of IMEIs are used.

row.entry: This parameter indicates the type of Device.

entry.p: When you create a device, the device type is set to NORMAL and this is visible on SM GUI only after the record is successfully created.
In case of unknown device, the device type is set to TEMPLATE. Once the unknown to known device transition happens using RENAME APIs (REST), the device type changes to NORMAL.

row.entry: This parameter indicates the security domain associated with the device.
Select the required security domain from the predefined security domains in the drop-down list.
This parameter indicates whether the overage is allowed. It is selected by default.
Select this check box to enable overage
This parameter indicates whether an OCS over the Sy interface is enabled or not.
Select this check box to enable an OCS over the Sy interface.
This parameter indicates the destination realm of OCS allowing you to select a specific OCS from a group of OCSs based on the subscriber device.
Enter the destination realm of OCS.
This parameter indicates the destination host of OCS allowing you to select a specific OCS from a group of OCSs based on the subscriber device.
Enter the destination host of the OCS.

entry.p: Add time of day: This enables the time of day feature that allows timed access to data plans based on a predefined configuration. In this feature, a device is either allowed or denied access to the network. However, overlapping time intervals are not allowed.
Note: The Time-Of-Day (ToD) blocking feature is specific to NCC-Policy and not used for NCC charging deployments.
The following parameters are listed when you click the ADD TIME OF DAY button.

row.entry: This parameter indicates the time zone for the subscriber device.

entry.p: This value is either in the range of -12:00 to +14:00 UTC +offset.
For example, the UTC+14 (time zone) on Wednesday, January 25, 2017 at 2:00 pm corresponds to UTC (GMT) Wednesday, January 25, 2017 at 12:00 am.

row.entry: This parameter indicates whether Daylight Saving Time (DST) is in force or not in the time zone.

entry.p: If DST is in force in the time zone, then check this parameter check box in the SM GUI.
If DST is not in force in the time zone, then do not check this parameter check box in the SM GUI.

row.entry: This parameter indicates the day of the week.
Select the required day from the drop-down list starting from SUNDAY, MONDAY, TUESDAY,.....,SATURDAY.
This parameter indicates the time at which the interval starts.
Select the time interval in HH:mm:ss format from the drop-down list.
This parameter indicates the day of the week indicating the end of the interval.
Select the required day from the drop-down list starting from SUNDAY, MONDAY, TUESDAY,.....,SATURDAY.
This parameter indicates the time at which the interval ends.
Select the time interval in HH:mm:ss format from the drop-down list.
Sets the ToD interval as BLOCK, THROTTLE or NONE.

entry.p: Select either of the following:
Parameter
Description
Options
Mandatory/Optional

row.entry: This parameter indicates the name of the notification profile associated with the device.
Select the required notification profile associated with the device.
This parameter indicates the name of the lifecycle you want to associate with the device.
This parameter indicates the state of the device.

Denotes the time used for entity lifecycle of device and refers to the validity time of a given state of that lifecycle. It is set when timer is configured in a lifecycle state transition. It is a read only parameter and is not set/updated in the Create/Update requests of lifecycle entities. It is only set internally by the lifecycle state transitions.
Set when timer is configured in lifecycle state transition
This parameter indicates the subscription index number for the device.
Select the required subscription index number from the drop-down list.
This parameter provides the list of aggregate view created that can be selected for the device.
Select the required aggregate view from the drop-down list.
This parameter indicates the username of the device owner.

entry.p: String
Enter a unique username as the parameter value.

row.entry: This parameter indicates the name of the groups to which the device belongs.
Enter a group name or object ID added by the addDeviceToGroup action.
This parameter indicates the language used for notifications.
Select the required language from the drop-down list.
This parameter indicates the name of the Managed Element to which this device can be distributed.
Select the required Managed Element from the drop-down list.

entry.p: This parameter indicates a list of categories in a sequence defined by device for consumption of the charging service. If the value is not provided, then this parameter gets updated with the category list defined by the operator in the CategoryOrder entity.
Note that this parameter value cannot be null in the database.
List<String>
Default: DefaultCategory
Add subscriptions: This enables to add subscription associated with the device.
The following parameters are listed when you click the ADD SUBSCRIPTIONS button:

row.entry: This parameter indicates the name of the bundle in the subscription.
Select the required bundle from the drop-down list.
This parameter indicates the account name associated with the subscription.

entry.p: String
Enter a unique account name in this field.

row.entry: This parameter indicates the fee for subscription.

The future time at which the subscription gets activated. It is an optional parameter in the subscription request object. If it is set, then the subscription is not activated immediately rather it gets activated at a future time (provided the relevant lifecycle is configured for this). One cannot set a time of past in this field. In addition, once set, this field cannot be updated.

entry.p: Parameter
Description
Options
Mandatory/Optional
Add custom data: This enables to add custom data dictionary to the device.
The following parameters are listed when you click the ADD CUSTOM DATA button:

row.entry: This parameter indicates the name of a custom data pre-configured in the custom data dictionary.
Select the required key from the drop-down list.
Mandatory if custom data is added.
This parameter indicates the type that is not configurable and pre-configured in the custom data dictionary.

entry.p: Select the type from the drop-down list that can be either of the following:

row.entry: Mandatory if custom data is added.

entry.p: This parameter indicates the value for the type configured.
Note: For every value that you add, press the Enter key and click Save.

row.entry: This is a pre-selected drop-down. It indicates a value as per the value of the key parameter selected.
Mandatory if custom data is added.
